info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 8:01AM EST until January 14 at 8:30AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM EST FOR SOUTHEASTERN WESTMORELAND AND CENTRAL FAYETTE COUNTIES... At 800 AM EST, a hazardous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Vinco to near Seven Springs to near South Connellsville to near Uniontown, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 84 and 99. Locations impacted include... Uniontown, Connellsville, Scottdale, South Connellsville, Ligonier, Seven Springs, Dunbar, Everson, Vanderbilt, Dawson, New Salem, Laurel Mountain, Donegal, Chalkhill, Champion, Ohiopyle, Mill Run, Indian Head, Acme, and Jones Mills. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
